snippet: At their best, the essays in David Foster Wallace’s “Both Flesh and Not” remind us of his capacity to make leaps from the mundane to the metaphysical with breathtaking velocity.
abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book Both Flesh and Not: Essays by David Foster Wallace.
lead_paragraph: At their best, the essays in David Foster Wallace’s “Both Flesh and Not” remind us of his capacity to make leaps from the mundane to the metaphysical with breathtaking velocity.

headline.seo: ‘Both Flesh and Not’ by David Foster Wallace
headline.main: Lengthy Insights, Vividly Served at High Velocity
headline.print_headline: Lengthy Insights, Vividly Served At High Velocity
